title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:41  
sburjan - (09:45): hello jvdrean  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:48  
jvdrean - (09:49): hi  
sburjan - (10:04): i want to report a problem with panels. More exactly with the search panel that you can drag and drop. the Go button (actually a image) is badly rendered  
sburjan - (10:06): and I see that the CSS code if the go button is somehow tied with the default search bar from the top of the page (I don;t think this should be happening)  
tmortagne left at 10:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:10  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:12  
tmortagne - (10:22): [myxwiki] Stopping myxwiki.org for upgrade  
sburjan - (10:32): on the document index page, the copy icon.. renders pretty strange. it should be fixed  
sburjan - (10:33): url("/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/page\_white\_copy.gif") should be changed  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:43  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:48  
tmortagne - (10:50): [myxwiki] Upgrade done  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:55  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 11:02  
Enygma` left at 11:03 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
mflorea left at 11:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (11:12): sdumitriu: re setDataAreaRatio i just tried with+1.0.0RC1 and without+1.0.13 it and it does seems to change anything to the statistics charts at least, do we have other charts in default XE ?  
tmortagne - (11:12): (and hi :))  
tmortagne - (11:14): i would be for sending a vote mail about simply remove this and upgrade to jfreechart 1.0.13  
sdumitriu - (11:17): +1 for removing it  
sdumitriu - (11:18): (and hi)  
mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 11:19  
tmortagne - (11:20): ok sending a mail then  
tmortagne - (11:26): mail sent  
sburjan - (11:28): tmortagne,  : so basically we are removing a component that nothing uses it anymore ?  
evalica joined #xwiki at 11:29  
tmortagne - (11:29): sburjan: not really since statistics is still not migrated and users are using it with the xwiki/1.0 chart macro too  
tmortagne - (11:29): sburjan: and i never talked about removing the plugin  
tmortagne - (11:29): i'm only talking about removing the call to setDataAreaRatio api  
sburjan - (11:30): oh, I see. and none of the functionality will be lost ?  
tmortagne - (11:30): we can't even figure out what it does (which is basically why we can't find an alternative)  
tmortagne - (11:30): at leats it does not change anything for the statistics charts  
sburjan - (11:30): I see. let's home it won't break functionality  
tmortagne - (11:30): s/leats/least/  
sburjan - (11:31): oh, that's okay.  
tmortagne - (11:31): sburjan: it will not break anything IMO, at worst it could maybe break chart image ratio maybe given its name but that's all  
npm joined #xwiki at 11:33  
florinciu left at 11:34 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (11:45): sdumitriu: is XWIKI-4908 still true ? (since you worked on classes recently maybe you already fixed it)  
sdumitriu - (11:45): Don't know  
sdumitriu - (11:45): I'll check  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:45  
tmortagne - (11:45): ok thanks  
evalica left #xwiki at 11:47  
evalica joined #xwiki at 11:47  
sdumitriu - (11:48): Seems to be fixed  
sdumitriu - (11:48): Maybe I forgot to close the issue  
sdumitriu - (11:49): Hm, or no  
npm\_ joined #xwiki at 11:50  
sdumitriu - (11:53): Huh, I thought the author is set in the store  
sdumitriu - (11:53): But no, it's set manually in Document#save and SaveAction  
sdumitriu - (11:54): Only the contentAuthor is set in the store  
sdumitriu - (11:54): #inconsistency  
npm left at 11:54 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
tmortagne - (11:56): yep not very nice  
jvdrean - (12:12): I'm back on the ui-tests issues on 2.3, I can't figure out how to debug it. First I'm not able to reproduce the query problem today, the only problem remaining on my computer is the unexecuted (not found) velocity macro, but of course it doesn't happen when I execute xwiki in debug mode (would be too easy)  
jvdrean - (12:12): I really could use suggestions here because I'm running out of ideas  
jvdrean - (12:13): note that the macro problem also appear on Main.WebHome (recent changes) when tests are executed, but not when I try by hand on the same distrib, and not when I execute tests on xwiki started in debug mode  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:20  
sdumitriu - (12:21): jvdrean: Logging  
sdumitriu - (12:22): Add lots of logs in the velocity related class and see what's not right  
mariusbutuc - (12:54): What is the XWiki Syntax 1.0 version of the Include Macro?  
mariusbutuc - (12:54): {{include document="SpaceOf.DocumentToInclude"/}}  
sdumitriu - (12:54): #includeTopic("SpaceOf.DocumentToInclude")  
mariusbutuc - (12:54): thanks sdumitriu  
mariusbutuc - (13:00): If I have #includeTopic('Code.Macros')  
mariusbutuc - (13:01): yet Code.Macros is written in syntax 2.0, the macros inside will not work, right?  
mariusbutuc - (13:01): they will not be accessible in the initial document, that made the include?  
sdumitriu - (13:09): If you have macros in that document, use #includeMacros("Code.Macros")  
sdumitriu - (13:09): You must use double quotes on #includeMacros to work  
sdumitriu - (13:10): I'm not sure it will work, though, combining 1.0, 2.0 and macros is very tricky  
sdumitriu - (13:18): Hm, I've been working on a test for XWIKI-5317, but I can't make it work, there's no way to forget the session  
sdumitriu - (13:19): Ah, there is  
sdumitriu - (13:20): getDriver().manage().deleteCookieNamed(arg0)  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 13:44  
sdumitriu - (13:58): Hehe, wrote a new ui-test  
sdumitriu - (13:58): It's nice  
sdumitriu - (13:59): Lot of work needed first to fill in all the different Page implementations  
sburjan - (14:06): shouldn't we create some internal standard for writing tests ?  
sburjan - (14:06): I mean so tests on the same module/functionality to have some degree of uniformity  
sburjan - (14:27): hello guys. I was testing M2 and found this when exporting the main page as PDF  
sburjan - (14:27): http://pastebin.com/RtpAc7jh  
mariusbutuc left at 14:27 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sburjan - (14:31): export as RTF gives something similar  
sburjan - (14:31): and export as XAR outputs in terminal a nasty error  
sburjan - (14:32): (all ofthere are in terminal or xwiki.log  
tmortagne - (14:35): sdumitriu: do you think XWIKI-2632 is still true ?  
sdumitriu - (14:36): Yes  
tmortagne - (14:36): ok  
sdumitriu - (14:36): But I don't know if it's a valid issue  
sdumitriu - (14:36): I'd close it as wontfix  
tmortagne - (14:36): ok (i did not looked at it very closely, just seen class property issue ;))  
sdumitriu - (14:37): At least the part about "a property that was deleted is kept whenever you save the document" is not an issue, you get a warning and you can remove that data now  
tmortagne - (14:38): ok then +1 for closing  
sdumitriu - (14:43): tmortagne: Are you closing it, or do you want me to do it?  
sdumitriu - (14:43): abusenius: Please don't commit .gitignore files  
tmortagne - (14:43): sdumitriu: i was expecting you to close it with a comment actually ;)  
sdumitriu - (14:43): tmortagne: OK  
tmortagne - (14:44): thanks  
sdumitriu - (14:44): abusenius: You should put ignores in the .git/info/exclude  
abusenius - (14:44): sdumitriu: ok, sorry  
sdumitriu - (14:45): No problem  
silviar joined #xwiki at 14:54  
sburjan - (14:55): tmortagne,  : so should I create a JIRA issue from what I wrote above ?  
tmortagne - (14:56): sburjan: sorry did not seen you messages, i'm looking  
sburjan - (14:56): @the pastebin link  
tmortagne - (14:58): sburjan: is it working ?  
sburjan - (14:58): well yes.. it exports  
tmortagne - (14:59): just give me 1sec, i'm trying to reproduce  
sburjan - (14:59): but the XAR works too.. but I get nasty errors in console.. I mean ... java errors  
sburjan - (14:59): okay  
tmortagne - (15:00): sburjan: could you give me the errors you get with xar ?  
sburjan - (15:00): 2 minz  
tmortagne - (15:01): i don't have any log with xar export, do you have attachments or something ?  
tmortagne - (15:02): nothing with PDF either except two usual WARN logs  
sburjan - (15:02): got it 2 times.. 3rd is unlucky. trying to reproduce  
sburjan - (15:03): PDF is true although  
sburjan - (15:03): RTF to  
sburjan - (15:03): too  
tmortagne - (15:04): could you give me a xar of your page so that i test the same content ?  
tmortagne - (15:04): according to the error you get it seems related to image attachments  
tmortagne - (15:04): maybe images from another document ?  
tmortagne - (15:05): that could maybe explain why it PDF exported can't find it  
sburjan - (15:05): i use default M2  
sburjan - (15:05): nothing modified  
sburjan - (15:05): I only enabled addidional languages and annotations  
tmortagne - (15:05): ok but what are you trying to export ?  
sburjan - (15:05): the main page  
sburjan - (15:05): home pge  
tmortagne - (15:05): ok so indeed i guess that's the issue  
sburjan - (15:06): is this normal ?  
tmortagne - (15:06): it probably can't find images of the user profile or something  
tmortagne - (15:06): i have no idea  
tmortagne - (15:06): it's a bug for sure  
tmortagne - (15:06): but i don't know if it's new  
sburjan - (15:06): yes, but before I report it.. I must check with silviar if she has the same issue  
sburjan - (15:06): I'll investigate  
tmortagne - (15:06): sburjan: could you try to export "simple" page  
tmortagne - (15:07): i trying the home page on my side  
tmortagne - (15:08): sburjan: just trying and btw no it doe snot work very well  
tmortagne - (15:08): lot's of links are broken in the PDF  
tmortagne - (15:09): now for the xar i really don't understand, whatever the content it does not change anything and it should work well  
tmortagne - (15:09): sburjan: +1 for creating an issue about PDF export and the home page  
sburjan - (15:09): okay  
sburjan - (15:09): silviar, has the same issue on a CLEAN download  
sburjan - (15:10): i'll create the issue now  
tmortagne - (15:10): ok  
sburjan - (15:10): unde what category should I issue it ?  
npm\_ left at 15:12 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
npm\_ joined #xwiki at 15:12  
tmortagne - (15:16): "export"  
sburjan - (15:17): in xwiki core  
tmortagne - (15:18): yes in core

sburjan - (15:24): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5319

tmortagne - (17:46): escapetool does not seems to provide that
